title: Olumo Rock Hiking and History Tour
description: Explore the famous rock, which was a fortress for the Egbas during the 19th-century inter-tribal wars and the source of Abeokuta's name, meaning "under the rock". It is the top tourist site in the state.

title: Historical Tour of the Palace of Alake
description: Visit the historical home of the Alake of Egbaland, the traditional ruler of the Egba people. This structure has lasted over the years and is a key place to learn about Egba history and culture. Relics and arts from decades ago are found within the palace.

title: Ake Arts and Book Festival Experience
description: Participate in one of the largest literary events in Africa, which typically runs for 3-5 days. The festival includes themes like book readings and discussions, art, dance, and cultural tours, attracting both local and foreign tourists.

title: Abeokuta Colonial Relics & Sightseeing
description: A historical exploration to discover relics from the colonial era, including the homes of Saros or Creoles who migrated from Cuba and Brazil in the 19th and 20th century, and the symbolic Centenary Hall, built in 1950 to represent one hundred years of peace.

title: Kurmi Market: History and Trade
description: Visit one of the oldest markets in Africa, built in the 15th century by King Muhammad Rumfa. It was a central hub for trade across the Sahara Desert and is considered a living museum.

title: Gidan Makama Museum: Story of Kano
description: Explore the history of Kano within a historic building using traditional Hausa techniques. The museum, which used to be a royal home, features 11 galleries covering various aspects of Kano's life, including religion, politics, music, and daily life.

title: Tour Kano’s Ancient City Walls
description: Walk along parts of the ancient walls, built between the 11th and 14th centuries to protect the city. These walls symbolize Kano’s historical strength and power and have stood the test of time (over 900 years old). Local guides can be hired for tours.

title: Durbar Festival Royal Parade
description: Experience Kano’s biggest cultural show, a royal parade held during Eid el-Fitr or Eid el-Kabir. The tradition, going back hundreds of years, features hundreds of horsemen in colorful clothing, drummers, and dancers. It is one of the most photographed events in Nigeria.

title: Kofar Mata Ancient Dye Pits Visit
description: Observe the 500-year-old traditional process of dyeing cloth using deep indigo pits. Visitors can watch dyers dip fabrics and hang them to dry in the sun, and buying local fabrics helps preserve this heritage craft.

title: Traditional Kano Food Tasting
description: Sample the rich local dishes of Kano. This culinary tour allows guests to taste traditional Northern Nigerian cuisine, including rice pudding served with thick, rich soups, and spicy grilled beef (Suya).

title: Nike Art Gallery Immersion
description: Explore the country’s largest privately owned gallery, which is part of the Nike Art Foundation. The gallery features a diverse collection of Nigerian paintings, sketches, sculptures, and mixed media, often reflecting traditional Nigerian life.

title: Contemporary African Art at Tiwani Contemporary
description: Visit the outpost of the London art house that focuses on spotlighting artists from across the African diaspora. The gallery's name, *tiwani*, loosely translates to “it belongs to us” in Yoruba.

title: Art Twenty One Solo Exhibition
description: Catch solo exhibitions by prominent figures, such as metallic sculptures and mixed-media installations, in this gallery located in the high-end neighborhood of Victoria Island.

title: Waterside Drinks at Sailors Lounge
description: Enjoy an evening at this two-story waterside bar, featuring a giant terrace and views of the Lagos Lagoon. The pulsing cocktail bar serves local drinks and small chops, like goat meat and mixed peppers.

title: High-Concept Nigerian Cuisine at Ìtàn Test Kitchen
description: Experience an exquisite eight-course meal featuring high-concept Nigerian cuisine, where each course (*ìtàn* is Yoruba for 'story') corresponds to a different Nigerian festival. Dishes are sophisticated presentations of traditional flavors (Note: The restaurant closed in July 2024 and is seeking a new location).
features: Exquisite Dishes (e.g., Yam in Snail Shell)

title: Beach Relaxation and Horseback Riding
description: Spend a day at Lekki Leisure, a serene beach getaway from the city rush. Visitors can watch beachgoers, relax in cabanas, and enjoy a guided horseback ride along the shore.

title: Contemporary African Dining at Nok by Alara
description: Dine at this contemporary African restaurant led by Senegalese-born Chef Pierre Thiam. Located in Lekki, the establishment also functions as a lifestyle boutique and features unique dishes blending traditional and modern flavors.

title: Port Harcourt Tourist Beach and Zoo
description: Enjoy this man-made attraction created in 1988 along the Kolabi creek line. The beach offers white sand, a serene environment, and hiking trails. The site includes a zoo and restaurants offering traditional dishes.

title: Iffoko Beach Seafood and Nature Trails
description: Explore this natural beach bordered by a rain forest. Visitors can walk the nature trails to see wildlife and enjoy freshly caught seafood from local restaurants. The beach is known for its exotic scenery.

title: Night Out in New GRA (Port Harcourt)
description: Experience the active nightlife scene in the New GRA neighborhood, known for having a lot of active nightlife spots for dancing and drinking. Visitors are strongly advised not to go unaccompanied by a trusted local.

title: Discovery Museum Comprehensive History Tour
description: Take a tour through Nigeria's political and military history, featuring displays on historic materials of the Igbo, Yoruba, and Hausa peoples, the slave tunnel, colonization and independence history, and exhibits on former Nigerian presidents.

title: Currency & Music History Tour (Abuja)
description: A focused tour of the Discovery Museum's upper floor, highlighting the evolution of Nigerian currency (Manilla, Cowrie shells) from 1914 to 1973. The tour also includes the music room, featuring traditional instruments like the *ekwe*, and the writer's box, displaying books by Nigerian authors.

title: Discovery Museum Art Gallery & Gift Shop
description: Explore the Discovery Museum’s art section, including a painting room that often features themes of women's resilience. View 'phantom' artifacts (replicas of lost works) and visit the gift room for souvenirs. Studio room rental is also available.

title: Coffee and Photoshoot at Sketch Restaurant
description: Visit this beautiful restaurant located near the Discovery Museum. Known for its cute outdoor decor, lighting, and colors, it is an ideal spot for taking pictures while enjoying a cup of coffee or snack.

title: Visit Untitled Art Gallery and Event Space
description: Explore Untitled, an Ikoyi gallery known for hosting panels and exhibitions featuring works by women. The space often invites makers to give studio sessions and talks.

title: Brunch at Calabar Aroma
description: Dine at the casual Calabar Aroma restaurant located in the Lekki Leisure neighborhood. This spot serves traditional Nigerian cuisine staples cafeteria-style, such as jollof rice and goat, or white rice and tomato stew.
